summary: This is a sealed application and supporting affidavit from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, filed on June 29, 2020, seeking warrants and orders for prospective and historical cellphone location information and pen register data for two cellphones believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The document is part of the investigation leading to her arrest on charges related to the sexual exploitation of minors with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submitted the application for the warrants and orders.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the target of the investigation, indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors and perjury. The affidavit states she is believed to use the two target cellphones.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a close associate and employer of Maxwell. His arrest and the seizure of his phone, which contained a contact for one of Maxwell's phones, are cited as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: She signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: She is the magistrate judge before whom the FBI Special Agent's affidavit was sworn.

persons.name: Joshua Perry
persons.context: Husband of a former Epstein employee. His phone was in contact with one of Maxwell's target cellphones as recently as May 2020.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's sister. Her phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target cellphones.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target cellphones.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account sent packages. His phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target cellphones.

connections.description: Described as a close associate and employee. Maxwell is charged with committing crimes together with Epstein.
Laura Menninger is identified as an attorney currently representing Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation.
Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister.
They share a joint bank account, and Maxwell's Amazon account has sent multiple packages to Borgerson.
Perry is the husband of a former Epstein employee, and his phone was in contact with Maxwell's phone.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed a warrant for her arrest the same day.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI on federal sex trafficking charges. An iPhone was seized from his possession during the arrest.

events.title: Application for Cellphone Tracking Warrants
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a sealed application seeking warrants for prospective/historical location data and pen registers for two cellphones linked to Ghislaine Maxwell to locate and arrest her.

keyFacts: The document reveals the U.S. government was actively tracking Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphones in June 2020 to locate and arrest her following a sealed indictment.
One target phone was subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.', Maxwell's non-profit, and the other to 'G Max', a shortened version of her name.
Evidence linking Maxwell to the phones includes a contact saved as 'Ghislaine' in Jeffrey Epstein's seized iPhone and call records to her sister, attorneys, and associates.
The application was filed under seal to prevent Maxwell from fleeing, destroying evidence, or intimidating witnesses.
The FBI sought 45 days of prospective location data, historical data from June 1, 2020, and pen register information for the phones.
